maml:description.maml:para: Disables an Ethernet port on a network switch.
The Disable-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort cmdlet disables an Ethernet port on a network switch.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies a device ID. This cmdlet disables a port on a device that this parameter specifies.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies a port to disable.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies a device ID. This cmdlet disables a port on a device that this parameter specifies.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies a port to disable.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects that correspond to an Ethernet port to this cmdlet.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Disable a port
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Disable-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort -CimSession $Session -PortNumber 21

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
This command disables port 21 for NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Disable a port by using a device ID
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Disable-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort -CimSession $Session -DeviceId "Ethernet17"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command disables an Ethernet port with device ID Ethernet17 on a network switch. The command uses a CimSession, similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Disables features of a network switch.
The Disable-NetworkSwitchFeature cmdlet disables specified features of a network switch.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies a feature name, an integer, of a feature to disable. A feature name might not be unique. This cmdlet disables all features with the same name.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the name of a feature to disable. This parameter supports wildcard characters.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the instance ID of a feature to disable.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies a feature name, an integer, of a feature to disable. A feature name might not be unique. This cmdlet disables all features with the same name.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the instance ID of a feature to disable.
Specifies the name of a feature to disable. This parameter supports wildcard characters.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects that correspond to a feature to this cmdlet.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Disable a feature by using its name
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Disable-NetworkSwitchFeature -CimSession $Session -Name "SSH"

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second command disables the feature named SSH for the network switch NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Disable a feature by using an instance ID
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Disable-NetworkSwitchFeature -CimSession $Session -InstanceID "Contoso:Feature:2"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command disables a feature by using the instance ID to identify it. The command includes a CimSession, similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Disables a VLAN of a network switch.
The Disable-NetworkSwitchVlan cmdlet disables a virtual local area network (VLAN) of a network switch.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the instance ID of a VLAN to disable.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the name of a VLAN to disable. This ElementName is a friendly name. It is not necessarily unique.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies VLAN ID of the VLAN to disable.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the instance ID of a VLAN to disable.
Specifies the name of a VLAN to disable. This ElementName is a friendly name. It is not necessarily unique.
Specifies VLAN ID of the VLAN to disable.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Disable a VLAN by using an instance ID
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Disable-NetworkSwitchVlan -InstanceID "Vlan02" -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second command disables the VLAN that has the instance ID Vlan02 for the switch NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Disable a VLAN by using a name
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Disable-NetworkSwitchVlan -CimSession $Session -Name "VLAN22"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command disables the VLAN named VLAN22. The command includes a CimSession, similar to the first example.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Disable a VLAN by using its ID
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Disable-NetworkSwitchVlan -CimSession $Session -VlanId 74

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command disables the VLAN that has the VLAN ID 74. The command includes a CimSession, similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Enables an Ethernet port on a network switch.
The Enable-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort cmdlet enables an Ethernet port on a network switch.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies a device ID. This cmdlet enables a port on a device that this parameter specifies.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies a port to enable.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies a device ID. This cmdlet enables a port on a device that this parameter specifies.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies a port to enable.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects that correspond to Ethernet ports to this cmdlet.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Enable a ports by using a device IDthe pipelinesa device ID
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Enable-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort -DeviceID "Ethernet17" -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second command enables ports for the device that has the ID Ethernet17 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Enable a port by using a port number
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Enable-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort -Port 21 -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command enables port 21. The command includes a CimSession, similar to the first example.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Enable-NetworkSwitchFeature -CimSession $Session -Name "SSH"

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Enable a feature by using its instance ID

The second command enables the VLAN that has the instance ID Vlan02 for the switch NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Enable a VLAN by using its ID
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Enable-NetworkSwitchVlan -CimSession $Session -VlanId 74

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command enables the VLAN that has the VLAN ID 74. The command includes a CimSession, similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets port information for a network switch.
The Get-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort cmdlet gets port information for a network switch.
Specifies a device ID. This cmdlet gets information for the port that this parameter specifies.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Indicates that this cmdlet returns only ports that have FullDuplex enabled.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Indicates that this cmdlet returns only ports that have FullDuplex disabled.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies a port number. This cmdlet gets the port that the parameter specifies.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies a device ID. This cmdlet gets information for the port that this parameter specifies.
Indicates that this cmdlet returns only ports that have FullDuplex disabled.
Indicates that this cmdlet returns only ports that have FullDuplex enabled.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies a port number. This cmdlet gets the port that the parameter specifies.
This cmdlet returns an array of CimInstance objects that correspond to Ethernet ports on a network switch.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get all the ports for a device
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Get-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second command gets the ports for NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get a specific port
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort -PortNumber 21 -CimSession $Session Name PortNumber DeviceID FullDuplex AutoSense PortType MaxDataSize ---- ---------- -------- ---------- --------- -------- ----------- Ethernet17 21 Ethernet17 True False 0 9214

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets port 21. The example shows the console output for the command. The command includes a CimSession, similar to the first example.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get a port with a specified ID
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-NetworkSwitchEthernetPort -DeviceID "Ethernet17" -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the port for the device that has the ID Ethernet17. The command includes a CimSession, similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets features of a network switch.
The Get-NetworkSwitchFeature cmdlet gets features of a network switch.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the name of a feature to get. Use wildcard characters to specify multiple features.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Indicates that this cmdlet gets only enabled features.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Indicates that this cmdlet gets only disabled features.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Indicates that this cmdlet gets only disabled features.
Indicates that this cmdlet gets only enabled features.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the name of a feature to get. Use wildcard characters to specify multiple features.
This cmdlet returns an array of CimInstance objects that represent network switch features.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get all features
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Get-NetworkSwitchFeature -CimSession $Session Name IsEnabled InstanceID PSComputerName ---- --------- ---------- -------------- SSH True Contoso:Feature:2 10.19.26.49 Tacacs True Contoso:Feature:3 10.19.26.49 BGP False Contoso:Feature:4 10.19.26.49 VLAN True Contoso:Feature:5 10.19.26.49 LACP True Contoso:Feature:6 10.19.26.49 DHCP False Contoso:Feature:7 10.19.26.49 LLDP True Contoso:Feature:8 10.19.26.49

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second command gets the features for the switch NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object. This example shows representative results.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get all enabled features
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-NetworkSwitchFeature -CimSession $Session -Enabled

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all the enabled features on a network switch. The command includes a CimSession, similar to the first example.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get all disabled features
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-NetworkSwitchFeature -CimSession $Session -Disabled

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all the disabled features on a network switch. The command includes a CimSession, similar to the first example.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Get features by using a name
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-NetworkSwitchFeature -CimSession $Session -FeatureName "*BGP*"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all features that contain the string BGP on a network switch. The command includes a CimSession, similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets global data of a network switch.
The Get-NetworkSwitchGlobalData cmdlet gets global data of a network switch.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
This cmdlet returns the globalData of the network switch as CimInstance object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get global data
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Get-NetworkSwitchGlobalData -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second command gets global data for the network switch NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets VLANs for a network switch.
The Get-NetworkSwitchVlan cmdlet gets available virtual local area networks (VLANs) for a network switch.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the caption of a VLAN to get.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the name of a VLAN to get. This ElementName is a friendly name. It is not necessarily unique.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the VLAN ID of the VLAN to get.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the instance ID of a VLAN to get.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the description of a VLAN to get.
Specifies the caption of a VLAN to get.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the description of a VLAN to get.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the instance ID of a VLAN to get.
Specifies the name of a VLAN to get. This ElementName is a friendly name. It is not necessarily unique.
Specifies the VLAN ID of the VLAN to get.
This cmdlet returns an array of CimInstance objects for network switch VLANs.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get all VLANs for a network switch
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Get-NetworkSwitchVlan -CimSession $Session Caption Description Name InstanceID VlanID PSComputerName ------- ----------- ----------- ---------- ------ -------------- Vlan_description default Contoso:NetworkVL... 1 10.19.246.18 Vlan_description VLAN0002 Contoso:NetworkVL... 2 10.19.246.18

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second command gets all VLAN for the switch NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get a VLAN by using a name
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-NetworkSwitchVlan -CimSession $Session -Name "VLAN22" Caption Description Name InstanceID VlanID PSComputerName ------- ----------- ----------- ---------- ------ -------------- Vlan_description VLAN22 Contoso:NetworkVL... 1 10.19.236.49

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the VLAN named VLAN22. The command includes a CimSession, similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a VLAN for a network switch.
The New-NetworkSwitchVlan cmdlet creates a virtual local area network (VLAN) for a network switch.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies a caption for the new VLAN.
Specifies a description of the new VLAN.
Specifies a VLAN ID for the new VLAN.
Specifies a name to use as the VLAN ElementName. This is a friendly name.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies a caption for the new VLAN.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies a description of the new VLAN.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies a name to use as the VLAN ElementName. This is a friendly name.
Specifies a VLAN ID for the new VLAN.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a VLAN
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> New-NetworkSwitchVlan -Name "Contoso07VLAN" -Caption "VLAN 07" -CimSession $Session Caption Description ElementName InstanceID VlanID PSComputerName ------- ----------- ----------- ---------- ------ -------------- VLAN 07 VLAN0004 Contoso:NetworkVL... 4 10.19.26.4

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second creates a VLAN for the switch NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an IP address from a port of a network switch.
The Remove-NetworkSwitchEthernetPortIPAddress cmdlet removes an assigned IP address from a port of a network switch.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the number of a port. This cmdlet removes the IP address from the port that this parameter specifies.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the CimSession to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the number of a port. This cmdlet removes the IP address from the port that this parameter specifies.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove an IP address from a port by using the pipeline
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Remove-NetworkSwitchEthernetPortIPAddress -CimSession $Session -PortNumber 21

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second command removes the IP address of port 21 by using the $Session object.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes network switch VLANs.
The Remove-NetworkSwitchVlan cmdlet removes virtual local area networks (VLANs) from a network switch.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the instance ID of a VLAN to remove.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies a name for a VLAN to remove. You can use wildcard characters to select multiple VLANs to remove.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the ID of a VLAN to remove.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the instance ID of a VLAN to remove.
Specifies a name for a VLAN to remove. You can use wildcard characters to select multiple VLANs to remove.
Specifies the ID of a VLAN to remove.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects that correspond to network switch VLANs to this cmdlet.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove a VLAN that has a specified ID
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Remove-NetworkSwitchVlan -CimSession $Session -VlanID 2

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second command removes the VLAN that has a VLAN ID of 2 for the switch NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Remove a VLAN for a specified instance ID
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Remove-NetworkSwitchVlan -CimSession $Session -InstanceID "Contoso:NetworkVLAN:Vlan4"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the VLAN for the specified instance ID. The command includes a CimSession, similar to the first example.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Remove VLANs that have names that contain a string
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Remove-NetworkSwitchVlan -CimSession $Session -Name "*Contoso*"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes all VLANs that have friendly names that include the string Contoso. The command includes a CimSession, similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Restores configuration for a network switch.
The Restore-NetworkSwitchConfiguration cmdlet restores configuration for a network switch to the last saved startup configuration.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Restore the configuration for a network switch
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Restore-NetworkSwitchConfiguration -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second command restores the configuration from the last saved configuration for NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

maml:description.maml:para: Saves configuration for starting a network switch.
The Save-NetworkSwitchConfiguration cmdlet saves the current configuration for starting a network switch.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Save the configuration for a network switch
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Save-NetworkSwitchConfiguration -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second command saves the configuration for NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the IP address on a port on a network switch.
The Set-NetworkSwitchEthernetPortIPAddress cmdlet sets the IP address of an Ethernet port on a network switch.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies an IP address for the Ethernet port.
Specifies a port number. This cmdlet sets the IP address on the port that this parameter specifies.
Specifies a subnet mask for the IP address.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies an IP address for the Ethernet port.
Specifies a subnet mask for the IP address.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies an IP address for the Ethernet port.
Specifies a port number. This cmdlet sets the IP address on the port that this parameter specifies.
Specifies a subnet mask for the IP address.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects that refer to an EthernetPort object.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Assign an IP address to a port
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Set-NetworkSwitchEthernetPortIPAddress -IpAddress "10.4.10.12" -PortNumber 21 -SubnetAddress "255.255.255.248" –CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second command assigns an IP address and subnet address to the specified port by using the $Session object.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the port mode on a network switch.
The Set-NetworkSwitchPortMode cmdlet sets the port mode to access, trunk or route on a network switch.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Indicates that this cmdlet sets the port to access mode.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the virtual local area network (VLAN) ID of the VLAN to set for the port in access mode.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies an IP address to set for the port in route mode.
Indicates that this cmdlet sets the port to route mode.
Specifies the subnet mask to set for the port in route mode.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Indicates that this cmdlet sets the port to trunk mode.
Specifies the VLAN IDs of the VLANs to set for the port in trunk mode.
Indicates that this cmdlet sets the port to access mode.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies an IP address to set for the port in route mode.
Indicates that this cmdlet sets the port to route mode.
Specifies the subnet mask to set for the port in route mode.
Indicates that this cmdlet sets the port to trunk mode.
Specifies the virtual local area network (VLAN) ID of the VLAN to set for the port in access mode.
Specifies the VLAN IDs of the VLANs to set for the port in trunk mode.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects that correspond to a network switch port to this cmdlet.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set a port to trunk mode
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> Set-NetworkSwitchPortMode -CimSession $Session -TrunkMode -VlanIDs 2,17,22

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second command sets NetworkSwitch08 to use trunk mode by using the $Session object. The command specifies IDs for three VLANs.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Set a port to route mode
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Set-NetworkSwitchPortMode -CimSession $Session -IpAddress "10.14.1.1" -RouteMode -SubnetAddress "255.255.0.0"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the port to route mode. The command specifies its IP address and the subnet mask. The command includes a CimSession, similar to the first example.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the port properties for a network switch.

The Set-NetworkSwitchPortProperty cmdlet sets the port properties for a network switch. This cmdlet can modify any property. If you run this cmdlet, you must specify at least one property to change. Otherwise, the command returns an error.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies a hash table of name/value pairs. The cmdlet sets the properties that this parameter specifies.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies a hash table of name/value pairs. The cmdlet sets the properties that this parameter specifies.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects to this cmdlet.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set properties for a port
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> $PortSpeed = 1 PS C:\> $Description = "Port on management device 02." PS C:\> Set-NetworkSwitchPortProperty -CimSession $Session -Property @{Speed = $portSpeed; Description = $Description }

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second and third commands assign values to the $PortSpeed variable and the $Description variable. These are the values of the key/value pairs.
The final command sets a properties by using the $Session object. The command uses standard syntax to create a hash table that contains the key/value pairs as the value of the Property parameter.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies properties on a VLAN on a network switch.
The Set-NetworkSwitchVlanProperty cmdlet modifies settable properties on a virtual local area network (VLAN) on a network switch.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies a hash table of name/value pairs. The cmdlet sets the properties that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies an array of VLAN IDs of VLANs to modify.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies a hash table of name/value pairs. The cmdlet sets the properties that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
Specifies the CimSession that this cmdlet uses to connect to the network switch. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Continue -- Inquire -- Ignore -- Suspend
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies a hash table of name/value pairs. The cmdlet sets the properties that this parameter specifies.
Specifies an array of VLAN IDs of VLANs to modify.
You can pipe an array of CimInstance objects that represent VLANs to this cmdlet.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set properties for a VLAN
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$Session = New-CimSession -ComputerName "NetworkSwitch08" PS C:\> $VlanName = "Contoso VLAN 07" PS C:\> $Description = "This VLAN is used to create a virtual Contoso company LAN" PS C:\> Set-NetworkSwitchVlanProperty -VlanId 12 -Property @{ElementName = $VlanName; Description = $Description} -CimSession $Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a CimSession for a network switch, and then stores it in the $Session variable. For more information about CimSession objects, type Get-Help New-CimSession.
The second and third commands assign values to the $VlanName variable and the $Description variable. These are the values of the key/value pairs.

The final command modifies the properties of the VLAN identified by the VLAN ID 5 to include the name/value pairs specified by the Property parameter. The command uses standard syntax to create a hash table that contains the name/value pairs. The command operates on the network switch named NetworkSwitch08 by using the $Session object.
